attributes.action: Ban the production and sale of small animal cages
attributes.additional_details:
Animals do not deserve to live a life in tiny hutches. Animals, no matter the size, deserve to live a good quality of life where they can move, stand and run freely. If a human wouldn’t want to be trapped a space they couldn’t move in, why should an animal? 
 
For example, animal welfare advocates recommend the minimum size a rabbit should be in is 3mx2m, but pet stores sell many cages that are 0.63m x 0.17m, as well as even smaller cages.
attributes.background: We think that almost all cages that are produced and sold in pet shops are far too small for all animals, particularly the ones they are marketed to.
